summary:

  • India's first match in the Champions Trophy will be against Bangladesh on February 20, followed by a highly anticipated match against Pakistan on February 23.
  • Bumrah has been a key player, having led in critical matches during the Test series against Australia.
  • The final squad for the Champions Trophy is expected to be announced by January 12.
  • Other regulars like Shreyas Iyer and Hardik Pandya are also likely to be included in the squad.
  • India is set to play three ODIs against England to gear up for the tournament.
"Bumrah, who led India in the first and fifth Tests, will serve as Rohit Sharma’s deputy if he is fit."

This upcoming Champions Trophy in Dubai will be crucial for India's white-ball cricket strategy and performance on the international stage.

title: "Everything was fine when Rahul Dravid was there": Harbhajan Singh suprised by Team India's downfall under Gautam Gambhir - Crictoday
summary:
“Everything was fine when Rahul Dravid was there”: Harbhajan Singh suprised by Team India’s downfall under Gautam Gambhir

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh questioned the team’s decline following Rahul Dravid's tenure as head coach. India recently lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to Australia by a score of 1-3, marking a significant downturn since Dravid's departure.

  • India celebrated success under Dravid, winning the ICC T20 World Cup 2024.
  • Gautam Gambhir took over as head coach but has seen disappointing results since.
  • India lost their ODI series against Sri Lanka (0-2) and struggled in Test series against New Zealand (0-3).
  • Harbhajan Singh advocates for selecting players based on current form, criticizing reliance on past reputations.
  • Notable struggles from key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in recent series.
“In the past six months, we lost to Sri Lanka, New Zealand and Australia. Everything was fine till Rahul Dravid was our coach. We won the T20 World Cup and everything was looking good.”

The commentary from Harbhajan highlights the urgency for the selectors to move away from a “superstar culture” and focus on deserving players.

Usman Khawaja discusses the challenges of facing Jasprit Bumrah during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, admitting he struggled against the Indian fast bowler throughout the series.

  • Khawaja's record against Bumrah changed this series, facing him eight times and getting dismissed six times.
  • Bumrah finished as the highest wicket-taker of the series with 32 wickets at an average of 13.06.

  • June 2025: India will tour England for a five-match Test series.
  • October 2025: India will host two Test matches against the West Indies.
  • December 2025: South Africa will visit India for two Tests.
  • August 2026: India will tour Sri Lanka for two Tests.

  • January-February 2027: Australia will visit India for a five-match Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

title: ‘Could be only one winner’: Johnson lambasts Sam Konstas for enabling India and Bumrah's ‘two against 11’ mindset - Hindustan Times
summary:

Mitchell Johnson criticizes Sam Konstas for his inexperience shown during an altercation with Jasprit Bumrah in the Sydney Test. The Australian pacer reflects on the implications of this incident in the context of the match.

“I appreciate what Konstas was trying to do by supporting his teammate, but it was simply the wrong time for that kind of engagement.” - Mitchell Johnson

title: 'Truth is that we are just white-ball bullies': Kaif tears into India after BGT loss - Cricket.com
summary:
Truth is that we are just white-ball bullies: Kaif tears into India after BGT loss

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized the Indian team's performance following their 3-1 defeat to Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy (BGT), suggesting that they focus more on red-ball cricket.

  • Kaif refers to the team as 'white-ball bullies', indicating a lack of skill in Test cricket.
  • He emphasizes the need for players to participate in domestic cricket like the Ranji Trophy to improve their red-ball game.
  • Kaif believes winning the Champions Trophy against Pakistan will not overshadow the need for Test match development.
  • He describes the series loss as a wake-up call for the team.
  • Kaif insists that without proper practice and experience on seaming tracks, the Indian team will struggle to succeed in the World Test Championship.
“The truth is that we are just white-ball bullies. We are lagging too far behind. If we have to win WTC, then players will have to play domestic cricket on turning tracks, will have to practice on seaming tracks.” - Mohammad Kaif

In conclusion, Kaif calls for a renewed focus on Test cricket if India hopes to succeed on the international stage.
newTitle: Kaif Critiques India's Red-Ball Performance After BGT Loss

  • Babar and South African opener Aiden Markram had a lengthy discussion to resolve the situation.
  • During the second innings, Pakistan reached 345/5 after following on from the first innings score of 194.

Australian T20 legend Dan Christian comes out of retirement to help the injury-affected Sydney Thunder in the Big Bash League (BBL).

  • Thunder has been affected by injuries to key players including Sams and Bancroft.
  • Christian has been active with UNSW in the NSW Premier Cricket competition to stay fit.

His return is not only a boost for the team but also a significant moment for his career and the BBL.

The Indian cricket team has faced a significant decline after the success of the 2024 T20 World Cup, leading to discussions about the impact of 'superstar culture' within the team.

“Everything was fine till Rahul Dravid was there. India won the World Cup, and everything was fine. But what happened suddenly?” - Harbhajan Singh

title: 'We’ll be back stronger': Yashasvi Jaiswal sets sights on comeback after India’s defeat in Australia - The Times of India

'We’ll be back stronger': Yashasvi Jaiswal sets sights on comeback after India’s defeat in Australia

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: Times of India

Yashasvi Jaiswal showcases determination for India's resurgence after their defeat in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series to Australia 1-3.
  • This defeat is India's first Test series loss to Australia in ten years.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was outstanding, taking the most wickets in the series with a total of 32.
  • Jaiswal achieved 391 runs in the series, including one century and two half-centuries.
  • Despite individual successes, Jaiswal expressed disappointment over the team's overall performance.
“I learnt a lot in Australia… Unfortunately, the result wasn’t what we had hoped for, but we’ll be back stronger. Your support means everything.” - Yashasvi Jaiswal

title: "The way he got out in South Africa, I doubted whether he would be able to score runs in Australia": Sunil Gavaskar hails Indian player for proving him wrong - Crictoday
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Praises Yashasvi Jaiswal's Performance in Australia

Published on: 2024-25 by Crictoday

Former India player Sunil Gavaskar has hailed Yashasvi Jaiswal for his performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy (BGT) 2024-25. Initially doubting Jaiswal's ability to perform in Australia after struggles in South Africa, Gavaskar now praises the young batter for his impressive run in the series.

  • India faced a 1-3 defeat in the five-match series against Australia.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 391 runs at an average of 43.44 in 10 innings.
  • Gavaskar noted Jaiswal's improvement and commitment to refining his batting techniques throughout the tournament.
  • In the Perth match, Jaiswal scored 161 runs in the second innings, contributing significantly to India's win.
“He improved as a batter after making mistakes. I was not confident of his success after watching him fail in South Africa on similar pitches,” Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar's insights reflect not only on Jaiswal's talent but also on the potential for growth after challenges, highlighting a bright future for the young cricketer.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Praises Yashasvi Jaiswal's Performance in Australia

title: THIS Indian player scored a century on Test debut, was once considered better than Sunil Gavaskar, career got ruined due to... - India.com
summary:
This Indian player scored a century on Test debut, was once considered better than Sunil Gavaskar, career got ruined due to...

Published by: India.com

Mohammad Azharuddin, considered a prodigy in Indian cricket, started his Test career in remarkable fashion by scoring a century on debut. However, his career faced a sudden downfall due to serious allegations of match-fixing.

  • Azharuddin scored centuries in his first three Test matches, earning the nickname "Wonder Boy".
  • He became a central figure in Indian cricket in the late '80s.
  • Led India in 221 matches as captain, a record until it was surpassed by MS Dhoni.
  • His career significantly derailed in 2000 due to match-fixing accusations.
  • Azharuddin finished his Test career with 99 matches, scoring 6,215 runs.
  • Post-controversy, he continued to have a successful ODI career.
  • The BCCI initially banned him for life, which was later lifted by the court.
  • He holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree from Nizam College, Osmania University.
"Azharuddin was a cricketer of immense talent whose career ended in regret."

The tale of Azharuddin's rise and fall remains a significant chapter in Indian cricket history, showcasing both talent and the devastating impact of controversy.
newTitle: Mohammad Azharuddin's Impressive Test Debut and Controversial Career
